channel.title: Call Of Duty
channel.description:
Anyone a fan of any of the Call Of Duty games? if so which ones? anyone else waiting for Modern Warfare 2?
I'd post the trailer to it but I don't think it's worth watching, waiting for a new one showing some gameplay.

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
Been playing CoD every since day 1, now have 5 years of modding experience - my best field is level design and scripting.

Got one mod running, check it out here:
https://www.moddb.com/mods/nuclear-apocalypse-uprising

Love all the CoD games.

The strongest thing about CoD is simply because it is fast FPS action on small maps, high performance and an insanely huge replay factor.
I have almost 2000 hours of multiplayer (CoD2) on Xfire, with many more when I had Xfire off.

As for the whining about the spawnsystem, it is not the devs fault…
Why? Because the maps were designed for 16 to 32 players (that is the absolute max) but for some reason admins want 54+ slots so the spawnsystem is flooded and the game cannot find a spawnposition where the enemy is not in the spawns pov.
Spawns are pre-made in the map thus the server cannot create ‘new’ spawns.

Read full topic

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
Trilby:

I played COD2. I strongly dislike it, though I was fairly good at it.
It boils down to a “you win if you’re behind the enemy” game.
I prefer the original Day of Defeat for my World-War fix.

Really? I enjoyed it. Each to his own I guess. Only problem is that multiplayer is dying. Non-mod servers with a manageable ping have decreased from 50 to 7 in the past 6 months. :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Brother Shrike:

Not to start a Halo vs CoD flamefest here, but I feel the same way about Halo. I don’t really see anything special about it, and I don’t really enjoy playing it that much. But some people cough feel the same way about CoD, so I guess it’s just personal preference.

So let’s all just agree to disagree. Sounds fair, and it soesn’t result in any infractions or lockings. That’s always a good thing (unless it’s a completely idiotic thread, like the ones created by a certain someone from the pre-fourm harddrive disaster.)

Read full topic

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Personally, I don’t see what’s so special about Call of Duty. Oh sure, there was a time where I did enjoy both Modern Warfare and World at War. But now, I look at my CoD loving friends as if they’re idiots. They pretty much jerk off everytime a new trailer’s released. Internet fourms and comments sections are not better. I simply want to enjoy a nice “Halo 3 Top 10 (Whatever),” but their’s always some retard that trolls “OMG halo sux cod iz so muz better it run 90 frames a second and u can shootz thru wallz lolz!!!”. So really, fuck them.
Now if you’ll excuse me, I’ll be playing Return to Castle Wolfenstein, the true Nazi-hating WWII FPS franchise!

Read full topic

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: Repzik
item.description:
The Reverend:

I too liked CoD2. I really want to play CoD5. My friend has it and it looks great. I heard there was a coop mode, is that true?

Also, Keresh, I have to say I have great admiration for how you dismiss people. All deserved sarcasm aside.

Technically there is no CoD5 yet, merely Call of Duty: World at War.

It’s kind of like Fallout: New Vegas being different than Fallout 4.

Read full topic

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: Suggestive
item.description:
The Reverend:

I too liked CoD2. I really want to play CoD5. My friend has it and it looks great. I heard there was a coop mode, is that true?

Yes. Upto 4 player. I don’t think you can play split-screen on 4 player.

As for vehicles - they annoy me so much.

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Dust:
  1. The campaign is just awful.
  2. Little has been added to the multiplayer from CoD 4. What has been added sucks (vehicles)
  3. The maps.
  4. Do you need any more.

This. Not to mention the world’s worst spawn system… EVER!
The only decent thing about it is Nazi Zombies.

Keresh:

He probably means “Real Half-life fan” or something. But don’t mind him.

I liked CoD2 and CoD4. Although the latter was a bit too short.

I too liked CoD2. I really want to play CoD5. My friend has it and it looks great. I heard there was a coop mode, is that true?

Also, Keresh, I have to say I have great admiration for how you dismiss people. All deserved sarcasm aside.

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description:
I like the first COD game (first game I was in a clan) and COD4, the two in between were good but nothing special. Never really played online since the first. If I started playing COD4 online, I’ll probably get hooked by what friends have said. :zip:

Read full topic

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
The addition of vehicles isn’t that bad, its good in the ‘Roundhouse’ map. And the maps themselves are OK. Campain, I didn’t play in 5(I only used the advanced beta), so I can’t say.

But I do agree theres not that much different from COD4

item.title: Call Of Duty
item.dc:creator: Reloader2
item.description:
Keresh:

He probably means “Real Half-life fan” or something. But don’t mind him.

I liked CoD2 and CoD4. Although the latter was a bit too short.

I must agree with you. It took me 4.4 hours to complete the game. On the second easisest difficulty though but still shorter. As an example, crysis is easier than cod for on delta then cod 4 is on the second easiest difficulty. And crysis took me longer to complete. Now that im done with my speech, fell free to post.

-Reloader2
